abstract.text: Access these properties using the functions described in Working with Global Information.

inlineContent.text: , in the context of one of these properties, is a pointer to a buffer containing data specific to the property. Each property description names the type of the data required. You provide the data when accessing these properties using the functions described in Working with Global Information.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
A type of marker within a file used in the
field of the
structure.
The playback direction of a looped segment of an audio file.
Properties used by the functions described in getting and setting pieces of data in audio files. See Working with Global Information for details.
Annotates a position in an audio file.
Flags for use when opening an audio file.
Flags that specify a playback direction for an audio file region structure.
Operating system constants that indicate the type of file to be written or a hint about what type of file to expect from data provided.
Read or write a variety of audio data to or from disk or a memory buffer.
Flags to set when creating an audio file.
Flags specified in a packet translation structure.
Key values of properties to get and set using Audio File Services functions and provide a common way to get the same information out of several different kinds of files.
A
of
containing all recognized file extensions. You can use this array when creating an
(declared in the AppKit’s
header file).
An array of HFS type codes containing all recognized HFS type codes. For more information on HFS type codes, see Audio Toolbox’s
header file.
A
of CF strings of all MIME types are recognized by Audio File Services.
A
of
of all UTIs (Universal Type Identifiers) recognized by Audio File Services.
An array of format IDs for formats that can be read.
An array of audio stream basic description structures, which contain all the formats for a particular file type and format ID.
A
of CF strings containing the recognized file extensions for a specified type.
The name for the file type.
An array of HFS type codes corresponding to a specified file type. The first type in the array is the preferred one to use.
A
of
of all MIME types recognized by a specified file type.
An array of
values containing the file types (such as AIFF, WAVE, and so forth) that can be opened for reading.
An array of all audio file type IDs that support a specified filename extension.

An array of all audio file type IDs that support a specified MIME type.
An array of all audio file type IDs that support a specified UTI.

of
of all Universal Type Identifiers recognized by a specified file type.
An array of
values containing the file types (such as AIFF, WAVE, and so forth) that can be opened for writing.
